title: Density fluid in two pools of different volume

content.question: A fluid has a density <math alttext="rho sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>œÅ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and is used to fill a rectangular swimming pool that has surface area <math alttext="A sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>A</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and depth <math alttext="d sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>d</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. The same fluid is going to be used to fill a larger pool with surface area <math alttext="2 A sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>A</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and depth <math alttext="2 d sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>d</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>. How will the mass <math alttext="m sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> of fluid in the larger pool compare to the mass <math alttext="m sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> of the fluid in the smaller pool?

choices.label: <math alttext="m sub 2 equals m sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="m sub 2 equals 2 m sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="m sub 2 equals 4 m sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="m sub 2 equals 8 m sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="m sub 2 equals 4 m sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
